prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Normalize counts, make two PCA plots for samples, one color coded samples by "group" and the other color coded by "LibrarySelection" in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", col_names = TRUE)
# Transpose the count table to have samples as rows and genes as columns
count_table <- t(count_table)

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Remove rows with missing annotation data
annotation_data <- annotation_data[!is.na(annotation_data$sample_ids), ]

# Get the sample ids from the annotation data
sample_ids <- annotation_data$sample_ids

# Subset the count table using the sample ids
count_table <- count_table[sample_ids, ]

# Create a DESeqDataSet object for normalization
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = count_table,
                              colData = annotation_data,
                              design = ~ Group + LibrarySelection)

# Perform normalization using DESeq2
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Get normalized counts
normalized_counts <- counts(dds, normalized = TRUE)

# Perform PCA
pca <- prcomp(t(normalized_counts))

# Plot PCA colored by "group"
plot_data <- as.data.frame(pca$x)
plot_data$group <- annotation_data$Group
ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot - Group",
       x = "PC1",
       y = "PC2")

# Plot PCA colored by "LibrarySelection"
plot_data$LibrarySelection <- annotation_data$LibrarySelection
ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = LibrarySelection)) + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot - LibrarySelection",
       x = "PC1",
       y = "PC2")
```
